name: Texas SandFest
description: World-class sand sculpture competition featuring master sculptors from around the globe.
longDescription: Texas SandFest is one of the largest sand sculpture competitions in the United States, drawing master sculptors from around the world to create incredible temporary art on Port Aransas beaches. The three-day event features competition categories, amateur sculpting areas, live music, food vendors, and activities for all ages. The sculptures—some towering over 10 feet—are breathtaking feats of art and engineering.
cost: Free beach viewing, VIP packages available
history: SandFest began in 1997 and has grown into one of the premier sand sculpture events in the country, attracting tens of thousands of visitors annually.

name: Deep Sea Roundup
description: Texas's oldest fishing tournament, celebrating over 90 years of offshore fishing tradition.
longDescription: The Deep Sea Roundup is Texas's oldest fishing tournament, dating back to 1932. This multi-day offshore fishing competition attracts hundreds of anglers competing for prizes in categories including kingfish, tarpon, ling, and more. The weigh-ins are spectacles themselves, with crowds gathering at the marina to see the day's catches.
cost: Entry fee for competitors; spectating free
history: Started in 1932, the Deep Sea Roundup is the oldest fishing tournament in Texas, helping establish Port Aransas as the 'Fishing Capital of Texas.'

name: Fourth of July Celebration
description: Independence Day festivities with beach parties, parade, and spectacular fireworks over the Gulf.
longDescription: Port Aransas celebrates Independence Day with Texas-sized enthusiasm. The festivities include a beach parade, sand castle competitions, live music, and the crown jewel—a massive fireworks display launched over the Gulf. The beach fills with families, the bars fill with revelers, and the sky fills with color.

name: Texas Legends Billfish Tournament
description: Premier billfish tournament targeting marlin, sailfish, and other pelagic species.
longDescription: The Texas Legends Billfish Tournament brings serious offshore anglers to Port Aransas for world-class billfish competition. Teams target blue marlin, white marlin, sailfish, and other pelagic species in Gulf waters. The tournament features significant prize money and attracts top boats from across the region.
cost: Entry fee for competitors; spectating free

name: Whooping Crane Festival
description: Celebration of the endangered whooping crane's winter residence with tours, speakers, and birding.
longDescription: The Whooping Crane Festival celebrates the return of these magnificent endangered birds to their winter home at Aransas National Wildlife Refuge. The multi-day event features boat tours to view the cranes, expert speakers, birding workshops, and nature photography opportunities. It's a must for birders and nature enthusiasts.
location: Port Aransas and Aransas National Wildlife Refuge
tips: Book boat tours early—they sell out
Dress in layers for boat tours

name: Harvest Moon Regatta
description: Overnight sailing race from Galveston to Port Aransas—one of the largest regattas in the country.
longDescription: The Harvest Moon Regatta is an overnight sailing race from Galveston to Port Aransas, one of the largest point-to-point regattas in the United States. Hundreds of sailboats make the 150+ nautical mile journey, arriving in Port Aransas to celebration and fanfare. The finish party is legendary.
cost: Free to watch; entry fee for racers
tips: Watch boats arrive morning and afternoon

name: Spring Break Season
description: Annual influx of spring breakers bringing energy, crowds, and beach party atmosphere.
longDescription: Spring Break transforms Port Aransas with an influx of families, college students, and sun-seekers escaping winter. March sees crowds peak, especially during Texas Week when most Texas schools are on break. The beach buzzes with activity, restaurants are packed, and the town embraces the energy.

name: Lighted Boat Parade
description: Festive holiday boat parade with decorated vessels lighting up the harbor.
longDescription: The Lighted Boat Parade brings holiday magic to the water as boat owners decorate their vessels with lights, themes, and creativity. The parade winds through the harbor while spectators watch from shore, enjoying the festive display. It's a beloved local tradition that kicks off the holiday season.
tips: Arrive early for good viewing spot

name: Beachcombers Bash
description: Community celebration with beach clean-up, local vendors, and family activities.
longDescription: Beachcombers Bash combines community service with celebration. The event begins with a beach clean-up effort, followed by vendor markets, food, music, and family activities. It's Port Aransas at its community-minded best—taking care of the beach that takes care of us.

name: Fishing Fiesta
description: Family-friendly fishing tournament with kids division and community celebration.
longDescription: Fishing Fiesta is Port Aransas's family-friendly fishing tournament, featuring divisions for kids and adults. The event celebrates the fishing culture that defines Port Aransas while welcoming newcomers to the sport. Weigh-ins, prizes, and festivities create a community atmosphere.

name: Port Aransas Art Center Shows
description: Rotating art exhibitions and gallery events showcasing local and regional artists.
longDescription: The Port Aransas Art Center hosts rotating exhibitions throughout the year, showcasing local artists, regional talent, and themed collections. Opening receptions, artist talks, and workshops add depth to the visual arts experience. The center is a cultural anchor for the community.

name: Port Aransas Farmers Market
description: Weekly farmers market with local produce, artisan goods, and community gathering.
longDescription: The Port Aransas Farmers Market brings local farmers, artisans, and food vendors together weekly. Fresh Gulf seafood, local produce, handmade crafts, and prepared foods create a vibrant community gathering. It's where locals shop and visitors discover local flavors.

name: Music on the Beach Concert Series
description: Free summer concert series with live music on the beach.
longDescription: Music on the Beach brings live performances to the sand throughout summer. These free concerts feature local and regional bands playing everything from country to rock to beach music. Bring your chairs, coolers, and dancing shoes for sunset entertainment.

name: New Year's Eve Celebration
description: Ring in the New Year with beach fireworks and downtown festivities.
longDescription: Port Aransas welcomes the New Year with celebrations throughout town. Restaurants host special dinners, bars throw parties, and the countdown culminates with fireworks over the Gulf. It's a festive but relatively intimate celebration compared to big-city chaos.
